so there's a lot of great information that we can get from error tracking performance monitoring and usage
analytics but obviously there are some limitations and I want to discuss some
of them I've alluded to a few of these already but the first and most important is that the client side is super noisy
if you're monitoring your server-side applications every message every error every alert is potentially something
real and something interesting if an exception is thrown in your server that was probably a real exception that
really happened when you get an exception from the client side it's a 90 chance it's garbage and it's
not real and you don't need to worry about it because the web is so noisy there's so many different kinds of clients there's people surfing on their
old game boys or on their Samsung refrigerators and you never built your site to work on a Samsung refrigerator
who tests that but these things are out on the web or there's Bots that are pretending to be
these things and they will send you data and so solving the noise problem is one
of the hardest things to do when you start getting into this and it's usually about filtering things down and saying
okay tell me about errors when three users or more have experienced it I
don't care about one two is kind of interesting three is okay this is a real thing that I actually care about
often you'll see errors that you know you might get 10 000 copies of an error that all happen to a single user
well you don't really care this is also the same reason why we use the 95th percentile when measuring
performance because a lot of those that statistics that we get is just garbage
the second part is around data privacy because observing our client-side Behavior often has to be balanced
against user privacy we cannot collect everything that we would ever want to
know without violating laws like the gdpr
um we can't there's certain things that we simply cannot capture about our client-side environments we without

as the user comes in which is just a crappy experience um the user doesn't want to necessarily give up all of their privacy just to

the third networks in geography people are going to be accessing your website from all over the world and so if
your performance slows down but you also happen to get a whole bunch of users from outer Mongolia
that might not be important unless you're serving outer Mongolia in which case that's super important but knowing
